TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class SqlChars : System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable, System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit SqlChars extends System.Object implements class System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable, class System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Docs.summary: SqlChars is a mutable reference type that wraps a <xref:System.Char> array or a instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks SqlChars can be obtained for `varchar`, `nvarchar`, `char`, `nchar`, `text`, and `ntext` values, or can be created over an unmanaged buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The maximum length allowed for <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars> is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(char[] buffer) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified character array.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The maximum length allowed for <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars> is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).
If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The maximum length allowed for <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars> is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).
If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.

Docs.summary: Returns a reference to the internal buffer.
Docs.value: Returns a reference to the internal buffer. For instances created on top of unmanaged pointers, it returns a managed copy of the internal buffer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Returns a null reference for null value <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars>.
Throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> for stream-wrapped instances of <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value is `false`. For more information, see [Handling Null Values](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public char this[long offset] { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the instance at the specified index.
Gets the length of the value that is contained in the instance.
Docs.value:
A <xref:System.Int64> value that indicates the length in characters of the value that is contained in the instance.
Returns -1 if no buffer is available to the instance, or if the value is null.
Returns a <xref:System.IO.Stream.Length%2A> for a stream-wrapped instance.

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum length in two-byte characters of the value the internal buffer can hold.
Docs.value:
An <xref:System.Int64> value representing the maximum length in two-byte characters of the value of the internal buffer.
Returns -1 for a stream-wrapped .

Docs.summary: Returns a null instance of this .
Docs.value: Returns an instance in such a way that <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.IsNull%2A> returns . For more information, see [Handling Null Values](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public long Read (long offset, char[] buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);
.method public hidebysig instance int64 Read(int64 offset, char[] buffer, int32 offsetInBuffer, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Int64> value offset into the value that is contained in the instance.
The character array buffer to copy into.
An <xref:System.Int32> integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.
An <xref:System.Int32> integer value representing the number of characters to copy.
Docs.summary: Copies characters from this instance to the passed-in buffer and returns the number of copied characters.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Int64> value representing the number of copied bytes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If an attempt is made to read beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.MaxLength%2A>, an exception is thrown.
If `count` specifies more characters to be copied than are available from the `offsetInBuffer` to the end of the value, only the available characters are copied.
An exception is thrown if the destination buffer is a null reference.
An exception is thrown if the destination buffer cannot receive as many characters as requested.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetLength(int64 value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the length of this instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method will trigger an internal conversion to a managed buffer for an instance built on top of an unmanaged buffer.

Docs.summary: Sets this instance to null.
Returns information about the storage state of this instance.

Docs.summary: Converts this instance to its equivalent representation.
Returns a managed copy of the value held by this .
Docs.value: The value of this as an array of characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Returns a null reference for null value <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars>.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (long offset, char[] buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);
.method public hidebysig instance void Write(int64 offset, char[] buffer, int32 offsetInBuffer, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: A value offset into the value that is contained in the instance.
The character array buffer to copy into.
An <xref:System.Int32> integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.
An <xref:System.Int32> integer representing the number of characters to copy.
Docs.summary: Copies characters from the passed-in buffer to this instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this operation writes to a position beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.Length%2A> but within <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.MaxLength%2A>, <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.Length%2A> is updated to reflect the new ending position.
The value of `offsetInBuffer` must be less than or equal to <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.Length%2A>. An exception is thrown otherwise. Only a value of 0 can be specified when writing to a null value instance.
If an attempt is made to write beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.MaxLength%2A>, an exception is thrown.
